meanings.definition: A rising of liquid from a subsurface source.
meanings.sent1: The upwellings of water from the deep ocean provide nutrients to marine life.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the upwellings in the ocean to understand their impact on ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The upwellings of soda in the fountain caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up from within her like joyful upwellings of a spring.
meanings.sent5: The upwellings of lava from the volcano painted a fiery picture against the night sky.

meanings.sent1: The upwellings of bubbles in the fizzy drink were fascinating to watch.
meanings.sent2: The upwellings of warm air signaled the start of a summer breeze.
meanings.sent3: The upwellings of laughter in the classroom made it hard to focus on the lesson.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits lifted like gentle upwellings of happiness in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The upwellings of joy in the crowd were contagious, spreading smiles all around.
